verb.description: Direct or command someone to do something, especially as an official order.
examples: I instructed that she be given hot, sweet tea
he instructed them in the use of firearms
instructing electors how to record their votes

verb.description: Inform (someone) of a fact or situation.
examples: the bank was instructed that the money from the savings account was now held by the company

verb.description: Give a person direction, information, or authorization.

origin: Late Middle English (in instruct (sense 2)): from Latin instruct- constructed, equipped, taught, from the verb instruere, from in- upon, towards + struere pile up.
